fields.description:

It would be useful to be able to zoom and scroll within the version and epic report graphs to allow the user to improve the resolution in any area of interest.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to zoom in on the epic and version report graphs.

fields.description:
h4. Current Situation
When creating a branch in git called e.g. "{{feature/PRJX-123}}" and pushing that to GitHub then the issue is properly displayed in the JIRA development tab.
But if the branch is called with lower case characters e.g. "{{feature/prjx-123}}" this will not be recognized by the JIRA DVCS plugin.

h4. Requested Change
The DVCS plugin shall be configurable that it can accept issues case insensitive, so that it accepts e.g. "{{PRJX-123}}" and "{{prjx-123}}" to be linked to the JIRA issue "{{PRJX-123}}".

h4. Use Case
Due to users working on Windows we've had a lot of problems with git branch names if they differ only in case. Therefore a GitHub pre-receive hook shall allow only lower case branch names, but this is in contradiction to use JIRA issue numbers as branch names.
fields.summary: DVCS connector shall recognize issue IDs case insensitive

fields.description: Update the "Time In Status" option in card layouts so that it displays the actual number of days in status instead of "None".
fields.summary: "Time In Status" available on card layout show numeric representation of days in status instead of "none"

fields.description:

As a user, I'd like to have different format for Release Burndown to show data.

h3. Suggested Resolution

fields.summary: Custom Release Burndown report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in JIRA Software if a status is removed from the workflow used by the board, the following will happen:

# Status removed (Eg: Open)
# Open status is used by issues when a Sprint is ended.
# Admin updated the workflow to remove the Open and replace it with To Do status.
# The issues with Open status when the Sprint was ended will not be shown in any of the report in the board.

This happens because JIRA Software checks whether the status which was set for the issues when the Sprint was completed. If the status is removed from workflow, JIRA unable the issues in the report due to missing dependencies (status).


h3. Suggested Solution

There are few ways to improve the existing behaviour:

# Show the data correctly regardless whether any of the status is removed from the workflow.
# Inform users on workflow change/removal of status for JIRA Software associated projects. This will prompt user to update the workflow to include the status which was removed previously.
# In reports, show users data that is not included in the sprint reports. Eg : Table of *Not belonging to any column* and its missing statuses.


h3. Workaround 

# Update the workflow used by the affected issues to include the status which was set to the issues when the Sprint was completed.
# The steps to add the status in the workflow is done to make sure that the status appears back in the board so the admin can map it. 
# Once it's mapped, the issues will be listed back in the report. If they do not want to have this status in their workflow, they can remove them back.
# Even when the status is removed from the workflow, the statuses will still be listed in the column management page (with exclamation mark).
fields.summary: Missing status in workflow affecting Agile report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since JIRA Software 7.1, we introduced *Manage Sprints* permission. See [Sprint Management permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-1-x-release-notes-788728210.html#JIRASoftware7.1.xreleasenotes-managesprintsSprintmanagementpermissions]. This has the sprints to be associated with a board in order to identify the correct permission that should be given to the sprint for "Manage Sprints" permission. 

It can be confusing for users when they are trying to "Complete Sprint" but unable to do so due to not knowing the *Original board* of the sprint. There is a separate Suggestion to help users determine the Sprint's Original board via the UI found in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-13265

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the "Manage Sprints" permission to be based on Sprint field's value's issues returned. If let say the sprint value will return issues from project A,B and C. It'll check the permission scheme of the necessary projects.
fields.summary: Manage Sprints permission to be based on Sprint data

fields.description: fdgrgre

fields.description:
This is just for Agile Sprints.  They have start dates, projected end dates, and completion dates.  We want to make sure these are mandatory and cannot be left blank when a Sprint is created.

Is it possible?
fields.summary: Agile Sprints.

fields.description:
I have used JIRA for a while now and I am a technical person so I know my way around. But as JIRA is getting larger, more and more units within the organization use it and not everyone is technical. It is EXTREMELY unintuitive to someone who doesn't know JQL to find and keep track of the issues they are mentioned on and issues they have been added as watchers. 

It would be amazing if you could add notification settings like FB where people can just click the field under Issues dropdown and click on the "Issues I am mentioned on" and "Issues I am watching". This would help MANY orgs be more productive and it will help keep track of tickets which won't get lost.

 

People do get email when they're mentioned on issues or added as watchers, but that's not helpful as there are many who get 1000000s of email each day.
fields.summary: Under issues dropdown please add "Issues I am mentioned on" and "Issues I am watching"
project

h3. Summary

As suggested by the title of the ticket, the link of the suggested documentation for the repository management tutorial popup is broken.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

 # Create a new ticket in that new project from step 1.
 # Wait for the popup to appear at the development panel.

h3. Expected Behavior

The link should point to a working webpage containing the desired tutorial. Not sure if this is the correct documentation but just putting it here in case it is, {{https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/comparing-workflows}} .
h3. Current Behavior

The link is pointing to {{[https://www.atlassian.com/git/workflows]}} which is broken at the moment.
fields.summary: Broken link at repository branch management tutorial popup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When JIRA service desk user want to use workflow trigger functionality, they couldn't find the *trigger* option via Workflow configuration after integrate with Bitbucket. The problem is they need to installed JIRA Software and associated with a valid license to make it works.

From our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-workflow-triggers-802592811.html], it mentioned this which is misleading:
{quote}While this page on triggers applies to all JIRA applications, triggers are designed to work closely with development tools, and are most powerful when used with JIRA Software .
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution

As a new JIRA service desk admin user, please update or add a note stated JIRA Software application is required to make the workflow trigger or JIRA development panel to works.
fields.summary: Improve Configuring Workflow triggers documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project names that contain more than one blank space does not show the spaces accurately

h3. Environment

* JIRA Software 7.2.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new JIRA project that has more than one space in its name. For example :
{noformat}
JIRA   TEST
{noformat}
# Browse to the project

h3. Actual Results

When browsing the project, the name of the project is automatically shortened so that it only shows a single space. For example :

!spaces.png|thumbnail!

In the top left, the project name is shortened to just 'JIRA TEST', with a single space. However, when going to the project details, it shows the real name of the project, with 3 blank spaces.
fields.summary: Project names with more than one blank space are not shown properly

h3. Suggested Solution

Add option in board configuration to allow Project Admin to customise which fields can be shown in issue's backlog view.


h3. Workaround 

None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be helpful to be able to change the default values within the sprint duration options. 

h3. Suggested Solution
This request is distinctly different from [JSW-7809|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-7809].  That case was just to allow users to choose a custom internal.


This request takes it the next step which would be to be able to have other options and preset here.   Presently the options are as follows:

* 1 Week
* 2 Weeks
* 3 Weeks
* 4 Weeks
* Custom

However it would be helpful in some environments that want to set their own defaults for this section.  For example:

* 2 days
* 4 days
* 1 month
* 20 hours
* Custom


h3. Why this is important
The current configuration will allow a scrum master to customize the interval.  But would help to standardize the default options within specific to that JIRA environment.
fields.summary: Ability to change default sprint duration intervals

{code}

fields.description:
Hello,

Recently we had a problem that a running sprint was deleted accidentally maybe by a mistake of an admin user. But there was no way to track how it was deleted and also no record left which JIRA issues were included in it before so we had to rely on our rough memory to recover the sprint.

I'd like to suggest a feature that will send a notification to (at least) the project and board admin users about status change of a sprint, just like the notification of issue status change. In the sprint deletion case it would be nice if a snapshot list of the included issues can be provided together.

Through this way we would be able to manage the sprints more securely and do a proper follow-up action quickly for such accidental case.

Thanks for your support in advance and hopefully this suggestion would be accepted soon.

 

Best regards,

 

Oliver Cho
fields.summary: Notification for the sprint status change

fields.description:
_User Story_

As a JIRA administrator, I would like the option to automatically clone the child elements of a screen or workflow scheme when I copy the parent because manually creating them takes a lot of time.

Our JIRA instance is shared by 35 development teams and, because the initial administrators were not well versed on JIRA functionality, most of them were set to share a single set of workflow and screen schemes. However they all want their own customizations independent of the other teams (don't ask), and so I am now going through and pulling them off of the shared scheme stack; making per-project copies of all of the workflows and screens for each of the 30 projects, and then re-building all of the mappings back up into schemes. Cloning the schemes themselves doesn't do me much good, because the underlying workflows and screens also need to be separate.

I could probably script this, but it would make sense to me that when I'm copying a scheme, I had the option to say "not only make a copy of this, but make copies of all of the underlying workflows\screens".
fields.summary: Allow Clone of Children When Copying Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Moving issues between JIRA Software projects can cause undesired behavior in Rapid Boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create scrum project A, create issue
# Create sprint fro project A, assign issue
# Create scrum project B
# Move issue from project A to project B
# Create sprint in project B

h3. Expected Results
New sprint in project B can be started/managed, etc

h3. Actual Results
Sprint from project A is visible in project B's scrum board, because of the moved issue. Sprints are not able to be managed in project B

h3. Notes
Screenshots, before removing sprint from moved issue:
 !before.png|thumbnail! 
 !before-new3.png|thumbnail! 

And after:
 !after.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Edit JIRA issue and remove sprint field data
fields.summary: Existing sprint information can cause trouble when moving issues between projects

fields.description: A very simple use of this bar that would allow me to be able to at a glance see how my epics (aka very large stories) are coming along would be to simply divide the number of completed stories in the epic by the total number of stories in the epic. E.g. suppose my epic has 5 stories and I've finished one. Then show the work comleted as 20%. Right now the bar is there and does absolutely nothing, which is at best, annoying.
fields.summary: Enable estimation completion bar in Epics on Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Now, if some issue gets very long rank, JIRA goes to 'Blocking rebalancing' state: no ranking is allowed until rebalancing is finished.

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of locking the whole JIRA we can disable ranking only for issues, which really have long rank
fields.summary: Don't lock ranking on boards during rebalancing
Changing order of neighbour issues does not narrow lexorank space

fields.description: At the moment JIRA is treating sub-tasks as added work to a US so any time logged and any estimation is added on to the US. Could someone explain the logic behind that to me? What I'm looking for is a way to further breakdown a US (i.e. into FE and BE), is there a way to do that? to further define some of the work done on a US? If not then are there any methods within JIRA to further iterate a US? Or are any other tickets essentially then just added work?
fields.summary: Is there a way to make sub-tasks "roll up" to their parent user story?
As an admin, I would like the ability to enable and disable LexoRank rebalancing so that I can control and defer expensive operations until after peak business hours

fields.description:
The User Story sub-task Tasking Functionality has gone from bad to worse.

Traditionally, tasking has been tedious due to having to move an individual task up/down was slow but appeared to remain on the same Single Page Application (SPA.) 

Now, moving a task up/down in priority (or reorganizing to group the tasks as the developer sees fit) appears to be causing a full page reload, which is even worse of a user experience.

Suggestions:
1. When creating many tasks, maintain the Assignee selected on the current task when "Create Another" task check box is checked.
2. Allow a task to be dragged and dropped without page reload.
3. Allow multiple tasks to be dragged and dropped without page reload (regardless of if they are contiguous or not.) 
3. a. Ability to Ctrl+Click tasks to highlight multiple tasks

3. b. They would drop as a contiguous set starting at high index
fields.summary: Enhance User Story Tasking Functionality

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a Sub-task inside an Epic or inside any issue that is linked to an Epic, the message "A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic." is shown, when, in fact, you CAN assign a subtask to an epic. It causes confusion for the users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Issue View of a ticket which is assigned to an Epic or to an Epic itself.
# Open *More* > *Create Subtask*.
# In the "Epic Link" the message is displayed.

h3. Expected Results
It would be better to clarify deeper, or even to hide that message in sub-task creation.
fields.summary: Improper Message: A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic

fields.description: It would be great to bring back the feature to create linked Confluence space on project creation but with a better usability (to assure no ‘accidental’ spaces are created).
fields.summary: Enable again the "Create linked Confluence Space" when creating a Project

fields.description:
Our users often rank dozens of issues in each column of their kanban boards during team meetings. These meetings are generally held in conference rooms where the kanban screen is zoomed in for everyone to see clearly, and only a handful of issues can appear on the screen at once.

The minimal real estate on a zoomed-in board makes it difficult for users to rank issues using drag-and-drop methods, so they regularly use the Top/Bottom of Column links to quickly sort issues. Several teams have noted how excellent it would be to also have a Middle of Column link to quickly sort issues that aren't the highest or lowest priority (but that don't need to be precisely placed relevant to other middling issues). 

There might be even more benefit to having an option to move an issue to a specific rank position without requiring drag-and-drop (i.e. Move to X rank of Column/Swimlane). Perhaps a new [Agile keyboard shortcut|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-keyboard-shortcuts#UsingKeyboardShortcuts-AgileShortcuts] like _s+#_ could send an issue to a specific rank position or even a percentile position (e.g. s+5 = 50th percentile rank position, i.e. middle of backlog).
fields.summary: Add a "Send to Middle of Column/Swimlane" ranking feature

fields.description: The edit button becomes invisible making it hard to find for some customers.  Customer is requesting an option to have the edit pencil visible at all times.
fields.summary: Make edit button visible at all times.

fields.description: It will be nice to be able to set a sprint when rising issues via email
fields.summary: Setting sprint via email requests

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

The JIRA Manage Add-ons page (and several other features within JIRA) is attempting to communicate to itself and does so using the base address. In a network setup where there is a Reverse Proxy requiring authentication, the reverse proxy is forcing the internal traffic from JIRA to the SSO and does not permit the unauthenticated traffic to go through.

IN [JRA-63795|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63795], we saw health checks failing because the requests from JIRA weren't permitted via the reverse-proxy based authentication. (In that scenario, however, the {{/rest}} endpoint was whitelisted, but it still produced an inconsistent result due to authentication at the reverse proxy level).

While we have the ability to bypass a reverse proxy/SSL by means of a secondary connector, we cannot tell JIRA to use this for internal requests - the Base URL is always used.

h4. How to reproduce

The overview of the customer architecture is that JIRA webserver sits behind a client firewall which uses SiteMinder via an Apache Reverse proxy for authentication. JIRA appears to be using a plugin to read the logged in user from a cookie.

h4. Expected Result

JIRA should be able to access itself locally and not go through the Reverse Proxy/external SSO.

h4. Actual Result

JIRA is accessing itself via its base URL and the SSO is not letting traffic through that is not authenticated. 

h4.Workaround
Workarounds will depend on your specific architecture, security requirements and other constraints. However, options include:
# Whitelist requests from JIRA to itself to allow anonymous requests
# If your authentication system supports it, use a plugin inside JIRA (rather than handling requests at the reverse proxy level) Moving the authentication to JIRA will allow it to correctly handle anonymous requests from itself.
fields.summary: JIRA integration with reverse proxy requiring authentication
Moia App

fields.description:
When you have 'no swimlanes' selected in a scrum board, and you have subtasks, the story header has no link to open that story in the sidebar.

Would be nice if you can quickly select the story that a subtask belongs to without having to search for the story card on the board.
fields.summary: Add link to the story header in "no swimlanes" mode

fields.description:

If we create a project and click on the link for creating a project with a *shared configuration* we can see a screen, where we can choose a project, which shares me his configuration.
we want to limit this list to a few entries.
To realize the limitation should there something like a flag if the entry(project) displayed in this list or not.

The thought behind it is, that the project creator can quickly get the configuration, without choosing the configuration under similarly named projects.
fields.summary: Flag for shared project configuration

fields.description: So many people are creating boards and when people leave or boards fall out of use I have no way of telling they are no longer used.  If a 'Last Accessed' date would display in the View All Boards list I would be able to see and delete all boards no accessed in (for my instance) over a year.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Developers have to maintain a separate documentation in Confluence for versions and release information intended for non-technical stake holders. On a JIRA Software Project with frequent releases, this introduces a lot of overhead for developers.


h3. Suggested Solution

Automate some documentation updates when a version is released in the JIRA Software Project.

{quote}When the "Release" button is clicked for a version in the JIRA Software Project :
- Update a "Released Versions Overview" page in the linked Confluence Space.
- Create a page for the version using the Change Log Blueprint.{quote}


h3. Why this is important

Versions and release information are relevant to non-technical stakeholders who doesn't necessarily need to be granted access to JIRA Software. Having the feature will reduce overhead of updating documents manually in Confluence every time a release is done in JIRA Software.
fields.summary: Software project release documentation update in Confluence

fields.description:

fields.description:
1) We have a phantom ticket in one of our queues.

2) We are receiving a message that 4 of the add-ons currently installed reporting Maintenance Expired - Would this cause an issue to functionality of these add-ons or is the license still valid but maintenance such as upgrading the version of the add-on has expired?

3) Reviewing the log finding entries like below2017-03-07 12:32:10,579 http-bio-80-exec-63 ERROR USERNAME 752x3614x2 16x63ir XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [jira.cw.functions.UpdateIssuesFunction] Notify your administrator that "Bob Swift Atlassian Add-ons - Update on Transition" requires a valid license. Reason: VERSION_MISMATCH
fields.summary: Assistance for a couple of issues being reported

fields.description: With JQL you can write a statement like {{issue.property[development].commits > 0}}. However, when I check properties with REST API like {{http://jira73.dev:8730/rest/api/2/issue/BAM-1/properties}}, the response is empty. I found that probably those values are coming from jira-dvcs–connector plugin. I want to be able to get at that data for reporting.
fields.summary: API for Dev Panel: commit count

fields.description:
This issue is to provide feedback on the JIRA 7 Users and Roles Admin Function. This functionality has been completely redesigned to have a sleek table format, which looks great! 
Unfortunately, the page no longer provides a full view of the settings. Now, only 5 users per role are shown and you must click "Show All" to see the rest of the users in the specific role, which at the same time hides the other roles. In the previous design, we had a full view of the settings and could easily compare the setup between roles. Now, we cannot do that.

Can you provide a view where we can see the full setup?
fields.summary: Feedback on JIRA 7 Users and Roles Admin Function

fields.description:
I have data on an old sprint which was recorded in Excel. Now, I want to import the issues into JIRA and be able to view sprint reports of the same.

I am able to view a burndown chart only when I change the scope of each issue, from 'To-do' to 'Done' or 'In progress'. The actual end date is way before the current date on which I changed the scope of the issues. But JIRA considers the current date (The day I change the scope of an issue) in the burndown chart.

Is there a way, where I JIRA can consider the actual end date mentioned in my sprint data sheet so that I could import my old data and still produce valid reports.
fields.summary: How to import an old sprint and produce sprint report?

fields.description:
As a Kanban Board user creating new issues, I would like the ability to include a newly created issue in as *To Do* vs. *Backlog*, so that it doesn't require multiple steps in going to the backlog + dragging + dropping.

Similar to the Agile Board, it would be great to have a configuration parameter to include in the Kanban Board, or after issue creation have the link to add to *To Do*/*Current Board.*
fields.summary: Kanban: ability to add new issue directly to board, or immediately after creation (similar to Agile --> include in sprint)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user, when I look at a ticket with subtasks, I can see the progress of each sub-task however it does not show me the hours unless I look into the sub-task details.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the settings to be configured to show the amount of time instead of the progress bar.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the remaining hours in a subtask instead of a progress bar

fields.description:
Prior to the development panel, under the build tab within JIRA you were able to see all builds associated with a particular issue. I would like to request that similar functionality be integrated back into JIRA as it pertains to the development panel.It would appear this functionality was taken out by design as indicated [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14922?focusedCommentId=634362&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-634362]

This current behavior assumes that the development team only cares about the last build and that all tests are run all the time which is not the case in our situation. We routinely will re-run only those tests that have failed.

In addition, for teams like ours who are regulated by the FDA and other international agencies the decapitation of this functionality removes our ability to centralize needed information within JIRA as it pertains to specific issues. We can no longer readily show a historical reference to our tests in one location. Thank you for the considerations.
fields.summary: JIRA to display total number and historical builds associated with issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

At the moment, JIRA DVCS Connector will periodically sync the connected Repositories every hour. When this happens, we only have the spinning arrows without any information about the sync. Then, when it is finished, we only able to see the "Last Activity" of the Repo.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Like how JIRA is doing a Sync when it is connected to LDAP, it will be great if it mentions about the time it took for sync such as:
 # If the sync is still going, how much time has elapsed?
 # If it is finished, how long does it take?
 # Info whether it is "Full Sync" or "Soft Sync"

h3. Why is it needed?

This could be used to monitor the sync performance when JIRA is doing it. Support could refer to this information as well to check all the information above that will help to troubleshoot.
fields.summary: DVCS Account Full Sync Time Report

fields.description:
The REST documentation for the upper call says:

*"Status 200* - _application/json_
 Returns a list of all JIRA issue statuses in JSON format, that are visible to the user."
  
 In detail this means only statuses are returned for projects, where the calling user has the permission "Browse Project". Statuses that are used with another workflow, that is used by another project only, will stay invisible to this user.
  
 But why can a full admin, who can add, modify and delete statuses (and see all, even non-associated in the UI) not receive the a full list of statuses with the upper call?
  
 At least, the REST documentation should be fixed to a wording like: "Returns a list of all JIRA issue statuses in JSON format, that are used by JIRA projects, that are visible to the user, regardless if normal user or administrator."
fields.summary: Unnatural behavior of REST call: GET /rest/api/2/status

fields.description:
I need some assistance understanding how to create project spaces, permissions whose membership is controlled by an LDAP group.  

I have followed the documentation, but am still missing some component.  We are evaluating this for a full offering of an on premise JIRA to all of Sandia National Laboratories.  It is critical that I solve this problem and get some guidance on best practices for creating protected project spaces.
fields.summary: Using LDAP group membership for project membership and management

fields.description: We would like to have activity log for the whole portfolio backlog. This is to keep track of any modifications (ie, epics reordering, additions, deletions, ect). Similar to what is currently available for user stories (once you open the user story). A drawback in adoption is Program Managers not having control of any modification on features after great deal of time investment in various rounds of discussions with stakeholders. This is why they still prefer to use spreadsheets, to keep the " latest" version saved. Hope this helps. Let me know if need more clarification.
fields.summary: Activity log for entire portfolio display for all at once.

fields.description:
Definition:
When hiding the Fix Version field, the issue on the Kanban board will disappear. However, there's no hint on what could have caused such impact. No error on the UI or even on the logs. 

Suggestion:
It would be helpful if a warning/error message will be displayed as to give a clue on why the issues suddenly disappear on the Kanban board.
fields.summary: Proper Warning or Error Message when Hiding the Fix Version field

fields.description:
A failure to parse a smart commit, when a user is not available in JIRA is sent to the commit author email.

This is documented in [the notes section|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/processing-jira-software-issues-with-smart-commit-messages-298979931.html#Notes]:

 
{quote}If a Smart Commit fails, JIRA Software sends an email notification to either the JIRA Software user, or to the DVCS user (if a JIRA Software user can't be identified). In rare cases, JIRA Software doesn't have either of these email addresses, and the Smjart Commit fails silently.
{quote}
 

This ends up spamming:
 * old employees
 * Fake emails 
 * Non JIRA emails

On every reindex, even when the commits in question were already failed before.

It would make sense to add a toggle to disable fail notifications and another toggle to send these only to JIRA admin.

This would also take care of silent failures as described in the doc.
fields.summary: Smart commit failure should be sent to admin

fields.description:
When linking a Confluence page (outlined [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-sprints/linking-a-confluence-page-to-a-sprint]), I am only able to search and link to the Confluence instance marked as the "primary" in the application links.  I would like to be able to choose which Confluence instance JIRA is searching in so that I could link to pages stored in non-primary Confluence instances.

Our large company runs multiple Confluence instances that are all connected to our JIRA instance.  The Confluence instance my team works out of is not the one designated as primary in the app link.  This means that I am unable to link pages to a Sprint or a Sprint Report.
fields.summary: Allow pages on non-primary Confluence instances to be linked to Sprints

fields.description:
Whenever clicking on a link within a JIRA ticket, it opens within the same tab. This happens frequently (by mistake) when browsing and commenting on tickets. Screenshots, dev urls, 3rd party sites, etc. 

Links within tickets should open in a new tab. This is a flaw.
fields.summary: As a user, I want links within Jira tickets to open in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users cannot disable the auto refresh of all gadgets at once. It only can be done one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option to allow users to disable the auto-refresh in a instance level or dashboard level.

h3. Workaround

Disable one gadget refresh at a time.
fields.summary: Ability to disable all gadgets auto-refresh

fields.description: occasionally if a customer sends in an email directly to an agent we may need to insert it between existing comments to keep the conversation in chronological order.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to insert a comment between existing comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no option in JIRA to add more information to the Issues in Epic section. Asking to have a way (maybe like advanced option jira.table.cols.subtasks for 
subtasks) to add columns either existing or custom fields to this list view.
h3. Additional Information
 - ability to see field "Component" so that it is upfront understood which Issue is related to which Component
- !image-2018-02-19-20-44-59-414.png|width=543,height=155!

Reference [https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/20/GHS-32672]
fields.summary: Ability to add columns to Epic Issue list on Epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, only issue keys in Github pull request *Title* will be considered into linking the PR back to JIRA issues.

Issue keys in the comment are ignored.

h3. Use case

This is to allow multiple issue keys to be reference without having to put all keys into the title causing it to be too long.
fields.summary: Take issue keys in Github pull request comment into consideration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user have more than 15 boards for "Boards in this project" list ( Go to *Board > Select Board > Boards in this project), it will not display in the browser. It also will effected when user have smaller browser.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create *Scroll Bar* for the list.

h3. Why this is important
 Customer need to view all the boards from the list.
fields.summary: Add scrollbar for "Boards in this project" list

fields.description: dkd
fields.summary: jdjd

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
File structure for logs are not consistent with other product.  Logs for JIRA are located in <jira-home>/log instead of <jira-home>/logs as well as a logs folder in <jira-home>.  This becomes confusing for users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a centralized logs folder for all logs.

h3. Why this is important
Some customers have have requested this to make JIRA more consistent with other products.
fields.summary: File Structure not consistent with other products

fields.description:
When there's a banner at the top of Jira, users cannot dismiss it. 

After they saw the announcement for a while, they may want to "turn it off" if they have seen it already.
fields.summary: Allow announcement banner to be dismiss-able by the end users

fields.description:
This applies to JIRA-Bitbucket integration....

I want to create Git branches from JIRA but I do not need to go into Bitbucket after creating the branch.  I rather go back to JIRA.  

 

The current workflow is:

*JIRA -> "Create Branch" Button -> "Create Branch for XXXX" Page -> "Create Branch" Button -> Bitbucket*

I then hit back twice to go back into JIRA.

 

Can there be an option for something like:

*JIRA -> "Create Branch" Button -> "Create Branch for XXXX" Page -> {color:#ff0000}"Create Branch and Return to JIRA" Button{color} -> JIRA*

or... maybe a radio option to choose to go to JIRA or Bitbucket.
fields.summary: After creating a branch in Bitbucket from JIRA, I would like to get back to JIRA

fields.description: We're migrating our JIRA server version 7.1.1 to a new windows host that currently runs an instance of SQL 2016. I need to confirm weather or not you support this version. I want to point out that during the migration we will upgrade JIRA to 7.3.
fields.summary: Upgrade to SQL 2016

fields.description:
A number of customers have requested a list of add-ons that come pre-installed with JIRA.  If a user does not check the compatibility prior to upgrading they will be left with add-ons that may be no longer needed.

In order to clean up the installed-plugins folder to save space a document that outlines which pre-installed add-ons from previous versions are no longer necessary would be helpful.
fields.summary: Add-on Changes between versions Documentation

fields.description: !Intermittent JIRA cloud server issues.JPG!
fields.summary: As a JIRA site-admin, I need to find out why JIRA Software User Management is down

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users are not able to customise the content of the cards in the Agile boards before printing them.

Customer would like the ability to:

# Edit the size of the card contents.
# Hide and remove content of the cards


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option in JIRA to customise the cards so users can add/remove content of the cards and resize contents in the cards.

h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Customize printing cards

fields.description:
Hi,
I have a main agile board which displays the current and future sprints inline for the sub-boards for my Project. Now if I create a new sprint from my main board it gets displayed in my sub-boards. But when i create sprint on my sub-boards it creates the next future sprint number on my sub-board and it gets displayed on my main board with the future sprint number which is a duplicate of already created future sprint in main board. For e.g. i created a future sprint SP-18 on my main board, then i went to one of my sub-boards and created another sprint SP-18 and assigned 1 issue from backlog to it. Now it gets displayed on my main board as SP-18 with the issue attached. I now have 2 SP-18.
Please help me resolve this conflict. It should not allow creation of same sprints which are already created.
fields.summary: Duplicate sprint names creating conflicts.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Board columns may swap positions by dragging and dropping one column on top of another column. When this is done, the two columns will swap places; If the columns are of different *Categories*, then the categories will also be swapped.

It is currently confusing in that board administrators may swap columns just wishing for the cards to switch places, but without switching Categories. A position swap may result in an accidental switching of categories, which will dramatically alter the board, and its metrics and reports

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for arbitrary placement of columns so that there may be any ordering of "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" categories, rather than forcing the "To Do" and "Done" categories to be on the left and right, respectively.

OR

Present a warning when swapping the position of columns with different categories that the columns will have their category adjusted as a result of the reordering.

h3. Why this is important
 
This will help reduce accidental misconfigurations of board columns by board administrators who will not be sure where to check when their metrics and reports spontaneously break.
fields.summary: Rearranging columns in Boards can be confusing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current {{POST /rest/agile/1.0/board}} only includes the following parameters:
* name
* type
* filterId

h3. Suggested Solution
As we can see from {{GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/configuration}}, we are able to extract more information from a board, it would be good if that information can be used for Create board REST API.

(i) The REST API documentation: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/server/
fields.summary: Enhance Create board REST API to include more information

fields.description:
Currently, in the kanban backlog, you can reorder the Subtasks only inside a parent task.

As described in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-issues/ranking-an-issue] KB article:

{quote}If an issue has sub-tasks that are in the same column and swimlane as itself, the sub-tasks will be shown in a group below the issue.
When you rank an issue that has sub-tasks, all of the sub-tasks that are currently grouped with that issue will be automatically moved with it.
Sub-task issues can only be ranked in relation to their 'sibling' issues.{quote}

If you change the parent issue status i.e send to the board, the subtask will be "stuck" in the backlog and the user will not be able to re-rank (drag-and-drop).

It would be good to also see the parent in the backlog and possibly re-rank the issue.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder subtask in backlog if parent is in another status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using JIRA Issue Navigator's Basic Search, you may also search on Sprint. If you have a lot of sprints, then there will be a scrollbar available to see all of the sprints. This scrollbar will cut off the last 2-3 characters of a sprint which is at or near it's maximum length (30 characters).

Compare a search without a scrollbar:

 !No_Scrollbar.png|thumbnail! 

Versus one with a scrollbar:

 !With_Scrollbar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the base width of the dropdown menu since it seems to be cutting it close (even without the scrollbar, it's cutting off half of the last character!)

h3. Why this is important

Best case, this issue occurring is an inconvenience and can cause confusion, and in general looks unpolished.

Worst case, this leads to the inability to identify the differences between two sprint names which are identical except for the last few characters.
 
h3. Workaround 

Use Advanced search; or correct the sprint choice after selection.
fields.summary: When searching for Sprint in Issue Navigator Basic Search, Scrollbar can cut off the name of long sprints

fields.description:
There is currently a file size limit of 10MB for photos using JIRA Mobile on iOS.  That makes sense from Jira's perspective, except it makes the rapid photo taking feature worthless on the new iPhone 7 and 7 Plus as there is no way to downsize the photo size.

So you either need to increase this limit enough to allow for the standard iPhone 7 photo size OR perhaps even easier, simply reduce the photo quality to fit within the 10MB.  See error message I get in the attached.  I get this every time I try to take a photo.

Summary:  For capturing a Bug or Feature request in JIRA you don't need 10MB worth of photo quality.  That's for sure.  However blocking the taking of photos altogether on the most popular phone on the planet is just plain wrong.  This problem is fixable with a simple software mod.  Just downsize the original photo to ANY size that fits under 10MB and be done with it.  Everyone is happy.

For example, see the screenshot I just exported from iPhoto.  Notice I can choose a "Medium" photo quality and the resulting PNG is less than 100KB.  That's a huge diff vs. the multi-MB original, and its easily viewed on this ticket.  Better for JIRA and just as good for development teams.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile for iOS - Photo limit of 10MB is untenable
